timeline.message: Add watcher setting to not use ILM

timeline.bodyText: Can you explain this change, just so I can better understand?
timeline.author: pugnascotia

replies.bodyText: The idea is that the lifecycle history index is irrelevant to these tests, so it's less setup and teardown.
replies.author: williamrandolph

replies.bodyText: The tests run fine with this setting enabled, so I'll drop this line.
replies.author: williamrandolph

timeline.bodyText: Can we remove ANOMALY_DETECTION_STATE_TEMPLATE_NO_ILM and STATS_TEMPLATE_NO_ILM now?
timeline.author: pugnascotia

replies.bodyText:
I will reach out to someone from ML to see if this change is OK, but I would guess that we will be able to remove those templates.

 get feedback from someone on ML for removing NO_ILM templates
replies.author: williamrandolph

replies.bodyText: @dimitris-athanasiou and @przemekwitek have confirmed that these templates can be removed.
replies.author: williamrandolph

replies.bodyText:
(Przemek from ML team): I think it is ok to remove the non-ILM versions.
Once only ILM versions exist, it would be good to inline the variables into the .json files but if you don't feel like doing it, I can do it as a followup PR.
replies.author: przemekwitek
williamrandolph

replies.bodyText:
Any of these 2 solutions work for me.
It's most important for me to get rid of syntax tokens (like comma ",") which were just a hack to allow enabled/disabled duality.
The first one is more flexible so my preference goes there.
replies.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: I've pushed a commit with the first, more flexible strategy. Thanks for the feedback!
replies.author: williamrandolph

replies.bodyText:
Could you make the variable name the same for both templates?
I.e. xpack.ml.index.lifecycle.name and xpack.ml.index.lifecycle.rollover_alias for both state and stats templates?
replies.author: przemekwitek
